title: An American woman and her child have been kidnapped in Haiti, organization says
description: A nurse and her child, both Americans, have been kidnapped amid crime and unrest in Haiti's capital, a nonprofit connected to the woman said Saturday.

title: Niger attempted coup marked by 'confusion, shifting alliances and fluidity,' State Department official says
description: A State Department official said Saturday that the attempted military coup in Niger has been marked by “confusion, shifting alliances and fluidity,” and that uncertainty is one reason the U.S. government has not declared it a coup.

title: Niger loses aid as Western countries condemn coup
description: The E.U. cut off financial support to Niger and the U.S. has threatened to do the same after military leaders ousted President, Mohamed Bazoum.

title: Melting ice in Switzerland reveals remains of climber who disappeared on glacier 37 years ago
description: GENEVA — The remains of a German mountain climber who disappeared while hiking along a glacier near Switzerland’s iconic Matterhorn mountain in 1986 have been recovered, as melting glaciers have led to the reemergence of bodies and objects thought to be long-lost.

title: Children among 9 injured by Russian missile strikes on eastern city, Ukrainian officials say
description: Two children were among nine people injured when Russian missiles hit two buildings the central city of Dnpiro late Friday, Ukrainian officials said.

title: Putin searches for more friends at Africa summit but low turnout dampens bid for influence
description: Russian pomp and circumstance greeted 17 leaders of African countries who arrived in St.

title: Julian Assange case has 'dragged on for too long,' Australian foreign minister says
description: Australia’s Foreign Minister Penny Wong said the case of imprisoned Wikileaks founder Julian Assange had gone on too long and needs to be completed.

title: U.S. announces $345 million military aid package for Taiwan
description: The U.S. on Friday announced $345 million in military aid for Taiwan, in what is the Biden administration’s first major package drawing on America’s own stockpiles to help Taiwan counter China.

title: India's ban on rice export triggers panic buying across the U.S.
description: Officials in India imposed a ban on the export of non-basmati white rice which has led to panic buying across the U.S., leaving shelves empty from coast to coast while store owners limit sales and hike prices. NBC News’ Meagan Fitzgerald reports.

title: U.S. orders government personnel to leave Haiti amid civil unrest
description: The State Department has ordered all U.S. government employees along with non-emergency personnel and their families to leave Haiti amid the recent rise in violence and civil unrest in the country. NBC News' Guad Venegas shares the latest.

title: More than 100 trans men enter Italian pageant after contest bans trans women
description: After a pageant representative said transgender women could not compete in the Miss Italy contest, more than 100 transgender men signed up, following the lead of Federico Barbarossa who turned the idea into a movement. NBC News' Ali Arouzi has the details.
